intro: Schistogyne oxypetaloides, commonly known as the narrow-petaled schistogyne, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals that are narrow and pointed. This plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
